page.title: 08Scarcliffe Wood_Wildlife
page.content: Many creatures live in Scarcliffe Wood.Near the stream we saw a coot.A coot is a black bird with a white beak.You find them near water.They make their nests there.Coots have webbed feet.They use their feet like paddles and they are good swimmers.They dip their heads under the water and catch fish. We saw swallows.Swallows are superb fliers.They obtain their insect food in flight and nest in colonies.Some nest in natural cavities or in burrows dug in the ground. Traces of foxes can be found in the woods.They are reddish_brown in colour with sharp eyes and pointed ears.Farmers and gamekeepers regard them as pests. Many grey squirrels live in the woods.They are small and move very quickly.They damage trees.
